verses.verse: Hear<WH8085> this,<WH5971> all you peoples. Listen,<WH8085> all you inhabitants<WH3427> of the world,<WH2465>
both low<WH1121> and high,<WH1121> rich<WH6223> and poor<WH34> together.<WH3162>
My mouth<WH6310> will speak<WH1696> words of wisdom.<WH2454> My heart<WH3820> shall utter<WH1900> understanding.<WH8394>
I will incline<WH5186> my ear<WH241> to a proverb.<WH4912> I will open<WH6605> my riddle<WH2420> on the harp.<WH3658>
Why should I fear<WH3372> in the days<WH3117> of evil,<WH7451> when iniquity<WH5771> at my heels<WH6120> surrounds me?<WH5437>
Those who trust<WH982> in their wealth,<WH2428> and boast<WH1984> in the multitude<WH7230> of their riches<WH6239>—
none of them can<WH376> by any means<WH6299> redeem<WH6299> his brother,<WH251> nor give<WH5414> God<WH430> a ransom for him.<WH3724>
For the redemption<WH6306> of their life<WH5315> is costly,<WH3365> no payment is ever<WH5769> enough,<WH2308>
That he should live<WH2421> on forever,<WH5331> that he should not see<WH7200> corruption.<WH7845>
For he sees<WH7200> that wise men<WH2450> die;<WH4191> likewise<WH3162> the fool<WH3684> and the senseless<WH1198> perish,<WH6> and leave<WH5800> their wealth<WH2428> to others.<WH312>

Their inward<WH7130> thought is that their houses<WH1004> will endure forever,<WH5769> and their dwelling<WH4908> places to all<WH1755> generations.<WH1755> They name<WH7121> their lands<WH127> after themselves.<WH8034>
But man,<WH120> despite his riches,<WH3366> doesn't<WH3885> endure. He is like<WH4911> the animals<WH929> that perish.<WH1820>
This is the destiny<WH1870> of those who are foolish,<WH3689> and of those<WH310> who approve<WH7521> their sayings.<WH6310> Selah.<WH5542>

They are appointed<WH8371> as a flock<WH6629> for Sheol.<WH7585> Death<WH4194> shall be their shepherd.<WH7462> The upright<WH3477> shall have dominion<WH7287> over them in the morning.<WH1242> Their beauty<WH6697> shall decay<WH1086> in Sheol,<WH7585> far from their mansion.<WH2073>
But God<WH430> will redeem<WH6299> my soul<WH5315> from the power<WH3027> of Sheol,<WH7585> for he will receive<WH3947> me.<WH5542> Selah.
Don't<WH3372> be afraid when a man<WH376> is made rich,<WH6238> when the glory<WH3519> of his house<WH1004> is increased.<WH7235>
For when he dies<WH4194> he shall carry nothing away.<WH3947> His glory<WH3519> shall not descend<WH3381> after him.<WH310>
Though while he lived<WH2416> he blessed<WH1288> his soul<WH5315>— and men praise<WH3034> you when you do well for yourself<WH3190>—
he shall go<WH935> to the generation<WH1755> of his fathers.<WH1> They shall never<WH3808> see<WH7200> the light.<WH216>
A man<WH120> who has riches<WH3366> without understanding,<WH995> is like<WH4911> the animals<WH929> that perish.<WH1820>
